line_1: Wild raves the wind, the arrowy light'nings flash,
line_2: Alarm'd! — he listens to the crash

line_1: Loud bellows the thunder; blue lightnings still flash;
line_2: The casements they clatter; chains rattle; doors clash,

line_1: Starts the red flame, and Death pursues the flash. —
line_2: On the pain'd ear-drum bursts the sudden crash,

line_1: From Calpè starts the intolerable flash,
line_2: Skies burst in flames, and blazing oceans dash; —

line_1: To quench at once the bursting flash!
line_2: At once the rising thought to dash,

line_1: And dreads to see the etherial meteors flash.
line_2: Heard the first murmur; while he waits the crash,
